intro: Hymenopappus biennis, commonly known as the blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer, and its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like. Hymenopappus biennis has a taproot system and is adapted to thrive in arid or semi-arid environments. It is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
